posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.28 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you’d like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium!

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No new notes, mostly bug fixes and non-visible changes!

Complete list of new commits since 7.27.1
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.27.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Obtainium
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.27 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.28.0 (149200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

52 new commits since 7.27.1:

Show commits

  • Fix backup perf issue by doing cleanup inline. [1]

  • Reuse generated backup file if it's less than one hour old and enable resumable upload. [2]

  • Use LibSignalChatConnection for Authenticated Socket based on Remote Config [3]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.0 [4]

  • Fix bugs with notification schedules caused by 24xx end times. [5]

  • Add log section for backups. [6]

  • Fix backups crash when not signed in to play store. [7]

  • Fix hot loop when creating a subscription to remote backups. [8]

  • Allow restoration over cellular [9]

  • Add additional link+sync logs. [10]

  • Fix system PIP not closing on call end. [11]

  • Fix thread merge update archive NPE. [12]

  • Handle group call creation failure. [13]

  • Add link+sync error flows. [14]

  • Add a copy button to the SQLite Playground. [15]

  • Self-heal payment state transfer if onAdded fails to update as expected. [16]

  • Add InAppPaymentTableTest to verify functionality of update method. [17]

  • Display descriptive error using payment data instead of generic error. [18]

  • Update string translation comments. [19]

  • Properly escape CSV output in playground. [20]

  • Fix possible backup validation error. [21]

  • Update to libsignal 0.64.0 [22]

  • Add improved archive upload progress. [23]

  • Remove explicit indexed by statement from approximate exportable message count. [24]

  • Fix post-transfer emoji search. [25]

  • Improved progress indicator for backup file upload. [26]

  • Convert more tests to kotlin. [27]

    Resolves #13829

  • Add thread delete progress logs. [28]

  • Add notification profile and chat folder backupv2 proto support. [29]

  • fixup! Add notification profile and chat folder backupv2 proto support. [30]

  • Update the backup playground to be more friendly. [31]

  • Fix dangling quote authors. [32]

  • Fix export issue with bad edit messages from during development. [33]

  • fixup! Fix dangling quote authors. [34]

  • Fix bad one-time-payment receipt creation for cancelled iDEAL. [35]

  • Update restore banners with progress indicators and redirection. [36]

  • Close selection bar when nothing is selected. [37]

  • Limit wallpaper uploading to media tier. [38]

  • Rotate quick restore QR code and web socket. [39]

  • Add additional error handling in regv3 flows. [40]

  • Add learn more urls for regv3 flows. [41]

  • Update story strings and button. [42]

  • Remove some badly-formatted e164's. [43]

  • Convert a batch of tests from mockito -> mockk. [44]

    Resolves #13832

  • Migrate all remaining mockito tests to mockk. [45]

    Resolves #13835

  • Fix instrumentation tests. [46]

    Resolves #13836

  • Rotate link+sync flag. [47]

  • Inline some paypal remote configs. [48]

  • Fix duplicate contacts during story selection. [49]

  • Fix delete options in note to self. [50]

  • Update translations and other static files. [51]

  • Bump version to 7.28.0 [52]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.27.1…v7.28.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: anon53652

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: These threads have become quieter since the last couple of releases have been mostly bug fixing, but I’m glad I can see so many commits fixing things to keep the app stable. Kudos to the team for the intense bug squashing!

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Hey, folks! One of the big things we’ve been working on in the background has finally produced a cool feature to test out – read more over here!

https://community.signalusers.org/t/help-us-test-desktop-history-syncing/65452/2

link_counts.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!

posts.name: Golden Dragonfly
posts.cooked:
When call end by weak signal or call get disconnect pip doesn’t close.

updates-bot:

Fix system PIP not closing on call end. [11]

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.28.0/48ba5f65dc51e7e6a39c4ba2b1ed534db0b3090675504c9fd21ab3a9a9b288a4

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
when answering a call while bluetooth headphones are connected, the headset isn’t picked as the default for audio, but the earpiece. switching to the bluetooth headset is also buggy - choosing it doesn’t work, you have to switch to loudspeakers, then to bluetooth headset.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.28.0/ecb38937997779becb2306f86ff2ae6d010bac6ceb3132efd6158d45b7e1261a

posts.cooked:
Version 7.28.0
I cannot create a group. I also cannot accept a group invite.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.28.0/55921541be6ff092043621b3aeb23fd2e34b1499da2a778a0bff3c6586a29183

Screenshot_20241216-221042901×1797 136 KB

Solved the issue: i edited my description and saved it. Then reverted the changes to my description. This was suggested here: Impossible to accept an invitation · Issue #12383 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
I dont know why this issue from 2022 happened in 2024 but this solved it.

link_counts.title: Impossible to accept an invitation · Issue #12383 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

26 new commits since 7.28.0

I think there’s some overlap here.
Looks like it’s actually 4 new commits (23, 24, 25 and 26) ?

updates-bot:
  • Bump version to 7.28.0 [22]
  • Fix derivation of RRP in RefreshAttributesJob. [23]
  • Fix incorrect RRP bugs and reglock state with reregistering. [24]
  • Update translations and other static files. [25]
  • Bump version to 7.28.1 [26]

Looks like they rebased it. If you check the commits from first bot post, Github will say those commits do not belong to any branch on this repository

updates-bot:
  • Add notification profile and chat folder backupv2 proto support. [29]
  • fixup! Add notification profile and chat folder backupv2 proto support. [30]
  • Update the backup playground to be more friendly. [31]
  • Fix dangling quote authors. [32]
  • Fix export issue with bad edit messages from during development. [33]

Feels like they squashes the fixup commit. Happens all the time in software dev
I haven’t seen 7.28.1 show up in Obtanium since it posted.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
np4gr:

Looks like they rebased it. If you check the commits from first bot post, Github will say those commits do not belong to any branch on this repository

Oh wow that’s wild. When I was halfway through pushing, I realized I forgot to squash the fixup commits. So I stopped the command, squashed, and continued pushing, because it looked like I hadn’t pushed yet to main. But it looks like I forgot to re-tag the rebased 7.28.0 commit, and the tag is pointing to the old un-squashed history! Apologies, not intentional :)

Avitus:

I haven’t seen 7.28.1 show up in Obtanium since it posted.

Ah whoops, script failed, had to re-run it :)

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: Is building on Windows officially deprecated now?

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked: It’s not, I honestly just don’t have easy access to a windows machine. But I’ll get the verification-metadata updated for the next release

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: It’s the same as for 7.25 so no need to trust me to post the correct hash.

posts.name: Daniel Pielmeier
posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

I honestly just don’t have easy access to a windows machine

I know this is off-topic but still

greyson-signal:
Avitus:

I haven’t seen 7.28.1 show up in Obtanium since it posted.

Ah whoops, script failed, had to re-run it :)

Just checked and it updated in the background. Thanks!
